entries.title: Six Nations: England's Henry Slade available for tournament as red card overturned
entries.description: England receive a Six Nations boost as Henry Slade's red card is overturned by a disciplinary panel.

entries.title: Takeaway owner says free pizzas offer has been 'very stressful'
entries.description: Marc Wilkinson thinks the month-long giveaway will cost him three times more than originally estimated.

entries.title: FA Cup 2023 - Liverpool 1-0 Wolves: Harvey Elliott scores stunning goal in Liverpool win
entries.description: Liverpool claim their first win since the turn of the year as Harvey Elliott's stunning strike proves enough to beat Wolves 1-0 in their FA Cup third-round replay.

entries.title: BBC apologises after sex noises heard during FA Cup coverage
entries.description: Gary Lineker says he found a phone "taped to the back of the set" after hearing pornographic noises.

entries.title: Wolverhampton Wanderers 0-1 Liverpool: Harvey Elliott fires visitors into FA Cup fourth round
entries.description: Liverpool claim their first win since the turn of the year as Harvey Elliott's stunning strike fires the Reds past Wolves in their FA Cup third-round replay.

entries.title: Forest Green Rovers 1-2 Birmingham City: Blues come from behind to win trip to Blackburn
entries.description: Birmingham City come from behind to beat Forest Green and earn an FA Cup fourth-round trip to Blackburn.

entries.title: Liverpool's Harvey Elliott scores spectacular opening goal against Wolves in the FA Cup
entries.description: Harvey Elliot puts Liverpool ahead with a spectacular goal against Wolves in the FA Cup at Molineux.

entries.title: Sudden unexplained death in childhood debated in Parliament
entries.description: Ex-Chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng tells Parliament sudden unexplained child deaths need more attention.

entries.title: Townsend on Scotland future - 'That's for other people to decide'
entries.description: Scotland head coach Gregor Townsend says his focus is on the Six Nations and his future with the national team is for "other people to decide".

entries.title: Italian held in EU-Qatargate bribery probe agrees to tell all
entries.description: Pier Antonio Panzeri is an alleged leader of a criminal network suspected of taking bribes from Qatar.

entries.title: EU biometric border system faces more delays
entries.description: A new border control system, which was pushed back to May, has been delayed to the end of the year.

entries.title: Aaron Ramsdale: Man charged with assaulting Arsenal goalkeeper
entries.description: A man is charged with assaulting Arsenal goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale after Sunday's Premier League match away to Tottenham.

entries.title: Manchester United: Sir Jim Ratcliffe's company Ineos formally joins process to buy club
entries.description: British billionaire Sir Jim Ratcliffe's firm Ineos officially enters the race to buy Manchester United.

entries.title: Scotland Gender Recognition Bill: What are the sticking points?
entries.description: Scotland's plan to make it easier for people to change their legal sex has led to a constitutional row.

entries.title: University staff join strikes on 1 February
entries.description: The University and College Union says staff will walk out "alongside fellow trade unions".

entries.title: Australian Open 2023: Emma Raducanu faces Coco Gauff & Rafael Nadal also in action on day three
entries.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu and Coco Gauff meet for the first time in an eagerly anticipated second-round match on day three at the Australian Open.

entries.title: Paperchase hunts for buyer but prepares for insolvency
entries.description: High Street stationery chain confirms it is hunting for buyer but talking to insolvency experts.

entries.title: Strikes Update: How nurses' strikes on Wednesday will affect you
entries.description: What you need to know about the nurses' strike and other industrial action, by the BBC's Zoe Conway.

entries.title: Greta Thunberg detained at German coal protest
entries.description: Protesters have been trying to stop a coal mine from swallowing up an abandoned village.

entries.title: Antonio Conte: Tottenham boss wants others at the club to also be held to account
entries.description: Tottenham boss Antonio Conte believes others at Spurs should also be held to account to explain issues at the club.

entries.title: Prince William reveals who's the best cook at home
entries.description: The Prince of Wales unveils his winning dish in the kitchen and rates Catherine's culinary skills too.

entries.title: David Carrick: More shocking cases may follow, Braverman warns
entries.description: The home secretary urges forces to root out corrupt officers after serial rapist David Carrick's case.

entries.title: UK weather: Snow and ice causes travel chaos and shuts schools
entries.description: Amber and yellow weather warnings for snow and ice are in place across the UK, as temperatures plummet.

entries.title: Prince Harry's Spare becomes UK's fastest-selling non-fiction book
entries.description: The much-publicised memoir Spare sells almost 500,000 copies in its first week.

entries.title: Nadhim Zahawi facing questions about tax payment
entries.description: The ex-chancellor is under pressure over reports he will pay millions to settle a dispute with HMRC.

entries.title: Matteo Messina Denaro: How Mafia boss was caught on a visit to a clinic
entries.description: Italian police arrested Matteo Messina Denaro as he walked from a clinic to a cafe.

entries.title: 'Andy Murray and his metal hip still defying the odds after Australian Open win'
entries.description: How does Andy Murray keep managing to leave us all stunned? The 35-year-old with a metal hip says he is proud of his Australian Open victory over Matteo Berrettini.

entries.title: Madonna announces 40th anniversary greatest hits tour
entries.description: The global tour will celebrate the 40th anniversary of her breakthrough single, Holiday, in 1983.

entries.title: Elon Musk begins trial over Tesla tweet that cost him $20m
entries.description: Shareholders are suing the Tesla CEO over a 2018 tweet saying he had the funds to take the firm private.

entries.title: Royal Mail accused of prioritising parcels over letters
entries.description: The postal service is accused of breaching its legal obligations, but the firm denies it is doing so.

entries.title: Australian Open 2023 results: Novak Djokovic, Alexander Zverev advance on day two
entries.description: Nine-time champion Novak Djokovic makes a perfect return to the Australian Open as he beats Roberto Carballes Baena.

entries.title: Andrey Medvedev: How Russian mercenary made an icy escape to Norway
entries.description: Andrey Medvedev's escape makes him the first Wagner Group mercenary to defect to the West.

entries.title: Britishvolt: UK battery start-up collapses into administration
entries.description: The majority of Britishvolt's 300 employees have been made redundant after last minute attempts to find a buyer failed.

entries.title: UK conversion therapy ban to include trans people
entries.description: The ban will outlaw attempts to change someone's sexuality or gender identity.

entries.title: Six Nations: Scotland include McConnochie, Healy, Henderson & McDowall in squad
entries.description: Former England wing Ruaridh McConnochie is one of four uncapped players named in Scotland's Six Nations squad.

entries.title: NFL: Dak Prescott stars as Dallas Cowboys beat Tampa Bay Buccaneers 31-14
entries.description: Watch the key plays as Dak Prescott stars for the Dallas Cowboys in a 31-14 wildcard weekend play-off victory against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers

entries.title: Ken Bruce to leave BBC Radio 2 show after 31 years and join Greatest Hits
entries.description: The long-serving DJ says it's "time for a change" and he'll join rival station Greatest Hits Radio.

entries.title: Six Nations 2023: Ken Owens to captain Wales squad that includes four uncapped players
entries.description: Veteran Scarlets hooker Ken Owens will captain Wales in the 2023 Six Nations, taking over from Justin Tipuric.

entries.title: Australian Open 2023: Andy Murray says 'I'll be feeling this tomorrow' after beating Berrettini
entries.description: Andy Murray says he is "incredibly proud" of his Australian Open first-round win over Italian 13th seed Matteo Berrettini.

entries.title: David Carrick: Metropolitan Police sack serial rapist police officer
entries.description: David Carrick admitted dozens of rape and sexual offences against 12 women across two decades.

entries.title: Warning after Amazon customer sent dog food instead of iPhone
entries.description: Ian Burton, from Salisbury, was initially refused a refund as he had signed for the delivery.

entries.title: Minister condemns 'draconian' gender reform block
entries.description: Shona Robison said the move by the UK government was a "dark day for democracy".

entries.title: Chelsea transfer news: How can the Blues keep spending?
entries.description: BBC Sport takes a look at how Chelsea can their keep spending within Financial Fair Play rules despite paying out more than £400m on new signings so far this season.

entries.title: Man arrested on US TV after 4-year-old filmed waving gun
entries.description: Neighbours reported a child, seemingly in a nappy, carrying a handgun during a police TV show.

entries.title: Train drivers to go on strike in February
entries.description: The train drivers' union Aslef has rejected a pay offer for its members.

entries.title: Eddie Jones: Ex-England coach would ignore RFU administrators at World Cup
entries.description: Former England coach Eddie Jones says he would ignore Rugby Football Union administrators if his Australia side meet England at this year's World Cup.

entries.title: BBC Breakfast turns back the clock on 40th birthday
entries.description: Russell Grant, Debbie Rix and Francis Wilson are among the familiar faces returning to the red sofa.

entries.title: Football: 'This is a very serious project' - Cesc Fabregas on Como
entries.description: Former Premier League stars Cesc Fabregas and Dennis Wise, now shareholder/player and chairman of Como respectively, discuss their current project with the Italian Serie B club.

entries.title: Teachers do not have to strike to get attention - education secretary
entries.description: The NEU announces seven days of strike action in February and March, affecting 23,400 schools.

entries.title: A39 Somerset: Double-decker bus with passengers overturns
entries.description: Emergency services are at the A39 Quantock Road, near Cannington, in Somerset.

entries.title: Cornwall snow: Schools shut and roads blocked
entries.description: A Met Office yellow warning for ice and snow is in place for Cornwall and parts of west Devon.

entries.title: Australian Open 2023 results: Andy Murray stuns Matteo Berrettini, Dan Evans beats Facundo Bagnis
entries.description: Andy Murray produces one of his best performances in recent years to hold off Italian 13th seed Matteo Berrettini in a five-set thriller at the Australian Open first round.

entries.title: Kevin Spacey given lifetime achievement award in Italy
entries.description: The actor - who is facing sexual assault charges in the UK - received the award in Italy.

entries.title: Tom Brady's future: Will NFL legend and seven-time Super Bowl champion retire after 23 seasons?
entries.description: Retirement, a new challenge or a move into TV? BBC Sport look at the options for NFL great Tom Brady after his 23rd season ends in play-off defeat.

entries.title: Pay rises at record pace but still below inflation
entries.description: Wages rose at their fastest growth since 2000 excluding the pandemic, but still lag behind rising prices.

entries.title: China's population falls for first time since 1961
entries.description: The birth rate fell to 6.77 births per 1,000 women - the lowest it has ever been.

entries.title: Chris Eubank Jr: Conor Benn has lost his 'credibility' after doping scandal, says rival
entries.description: Conor Benn lost his "credibility" after failing two drugs tests in the build-up to their cancelled fight, says Chris Eubank Jr.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Bakhmut defenders plea for Western tanks
entries.description: Ukrainians on the front lines call for hundreds of modern tanks, as the West debates new deliveries.

entries.title: Brixton Academy security guards regularly 'took bribes'
entries.description: Hundreds of people without tickets would regularly pay cash to get in, a whistleblower tells the BBC.

entries.title: NFL play-offs: Dak Prescott upstages Tom Brady as Dallas Cowboys knock out Tampa Bay Buccaneers
entries.description: Dak Prescott upstages seven-time Super Bowl winner Tom Brady as the Dallas Cowboys dump the Tampa Bay Buccaneers out of the play-offs.

entries.title: Scotland gender bill: What next for Sunak and Sturgeon?
entries.description: The Union has a clash on its hands, writes James Cook, BBC News's Scotland editor.

entries.title: Australian Open: Melbourne heat causes play to be stopped on outdoor courts
entries.description: The majority of play is suspended on day two of the Australian Open because of extreme heat, with temperatures going above 35C in Melbourne.

entries.title: Children pay royal tribute with their word of 2022
entries.description: Six to 14 year-olds were asked in a survey for words they felt had been important during the year.

entries.title: Brazil Congress: Dozens indicted over 8 January riot
entries.description: Thirty-nine people are accused of trying to abolish democracy in the violence on 8 January.

entries.title: Killamarsh murders: Probation failings over killer Damien Bendall
entries.description: Officers dealing with a man who murdered a woman and three children made failings "at every stage".

entries.title: Wikipedia needs different safety rules, says foundation
entries.description: The Online Safety Bill shouldn't treat community-run sites like big tech firms its foundation says.

entries.title: Ethnic segregation in England and Wales at all-time low - study
entries.description: People in England and Wales are more likely than ever to have neighbours of a different ethnicity.

entries.title: Nepal co-pilot's husband also died in plane crash 16 years previously
entries.description: Anju Khatiwada was co-piloting the Yeti Airlines flight when it smashed into a gorge near Pokhara.

entries.title: Antidepressants exit must happen in stages, says medical watchdog
entries.description: The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence says this is to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

entries.title: Australian Open bans Russian and Belarusian flags from tournament
entries.description: Organisers announced the flags would be banned, effective immediately, after a courtside incident.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Monster of the Met' and 'slapdown for Sturgeon'
entries.description: Tuesday's papers largely focus on David Carrick, the police officer who has admitted to being a serial rapist.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak bows to Tory revolt over internet safety law
entries.description: Tech bosses could face jail time for failing to protect children online, after a backbench rebellion.

entries.title: Cost of living: Experts share five tips for asking for a pay rise
entries.description: Recruiters, a manager and a workplace psychologist give their advice on how to negotiate for more money.

entries.title: Royal Mail ransomware attack leaves firms in limbo
entries.description: Small businesses tell the BBC they are facing delays and losing money as overseas post is stopped.

entries.title: Putin is weaponising food, says boss of fertiliser giant Yara
entries.description: The boss of Yara says Russia's invasion of Ukraine has driven up the price of fertilisers and food.

entries.title: Premiership rugby club finances not sustainable, says parliamentary report
entries.description: Premiership rugby club finances are "clearly unsustainable", a damning parliamentary report has concluded.

entries.title: Tunnel Ultra: The mind-bending 200-mile ultra-marathon in the dark
entries.description: One runner was chased by monsters. Another went blind. In the darkness, nothing is as simple as it seems.
